intro: Oligosporus, commonly known as the common spore plant, is a genus of fungi belonging to the family Sordariaceae. It is characterized by its small, compact fruiting bodies that produce a large number of spores. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or damp soil. Its spores are dispersed by wind, allowing for wide geographic distribution. Oligosporus plays a role in nutrient cycling in ecosystems through its decomposing activity.
